results.title: Nights of Cabiria = Le Notti di Cabiria
results.creator_credit: Federico Fellini, Dino De Laurentiis and De Laurentiis Entertainment Group
results.brief_description: Nights of Cabiria is Fellini’s bitter-sweet account of a resilient Roman prostitute desperate to find love and respect in marriage. Cabiria, played by Fellini’s wife Giulietta Masina, is the prostitute with a heart of gold who is in love with love. Endlessly searching for true love, Cabiria is continually disappointed by men - abused, deceived and betrayed - but she never loses hope. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Nightride
results.creator_credit: Della Churchill, Martin Murphy and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A masked killer, a series of brutal murders, a confined space, a resourceful young hero and a terrifying confrontation. Nightride cleverly condenses the conventions of the horror film established in Halloween and Friday the 13th into a suspenseful 11 minute film.

results.title: Nightride
results.creator_credit: Martin Murphy, Della Churchill and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A boy travelling on a night bus is witness to the murders of other passengers, by a masked killer. “Nightride” condenses the conventions of a horror film into 11 minutes, climaxing with a terrifying confrontation between the boy and the killer. This excellent Australian student short has won numerous international and national film festival awards.

results.title: Nightmare: the birth of horror
results.brief_description: The Victorian era saw the proliferation of the creation of horror stories that have permeated mass culture in the 21st Century. This series, written, presented and researched by Professor Christopher Frayling, recounts the origins of classic horror novels such as “Frankenstein”, “Dracula” and “The Hounds of the Baskerville”.

results.title: Nightmail
results.creator_credit: Harry Watt, Basil Wright, John Grierson and GPO Film Unit
results.brief_description: Classic British documentary recounting the journey of the ‘Postal Special’ train from London to Glasgow. Carrying no passengers, the postal staff sort mail on board and receive and despatch mailbags ‘en route’. The non professional cast performed scripted scenes, giving a human dimension to the mechanics of mail delivery. Along with a dry factual voice-over, the soundtrack offered music by composer Benjamin Britten and verse by W.H. Auden.

results.title: Nightlife
results.brief_description: Robin Lehman explores the wonders of the cold seas of Ireland. Shows the many creatures and plants, including scallops, sea anemone, fan worm and jellyfish. This fantastic drama captures some of nature’s most amazing and improbable creations. Without words but accompanied by music and sound effects.

results.title: Nighthawks. What can I do with a male nude?
results.creator_credit: Paul Hallam, Ron Peck, Nighthawks and Four Corner Films
results.brief_description: ‘Nighthawks’ pictures the everyday experiences of a homosexual schoolteacher in a film which is both a subjective account of the teacher’s disjointed emotional life, and a record of the gay scene in London towards the end of the 1970’s. ‘What can I do with a male nude?’ is a witty short film showing the point of view of a gay photographer as he photographs a muscular male model.

results.title: Night wait
results.brief_description: A lonely cripple wanders through the streets at night seeking companionship. A girl at a bus stop makes conversation with him but when he makes further advances she, like the rest of society, rejects him. Cast includes Noela Fergusson and Vittorio Bianchi.
